page.title: 10LANDSCAPE OF UPPER FROYLE
page.content:
Part of Upper Froyle has been landscaped in the past as parkland for the{Manor House.} There is a ha-ha at the side of the house and an avenue of lime trees from the house to the main road as a carriage-way. The garden of {Froyle Place}is laid out with pond, rockery, flower beds and yew hedges. These used to be cut in many shapes but have been cut back at present because they became too thick. The larger houses have well laid out gardens, the smaller have picturesque 'cottage gardens' and there are { {allotment gardens} in Upper Froyle.
The Beeches are a beautiful{line of {beech trees} dividing Lower Froyle from Upper Froyle.
